meanings.definition: Pouring liquid back into a container.
meanings.sent1: After spilling some juice, she carefully repoured it into the glass.
meanings.sent2: He repoured the coffee into his mug after adding sugar.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter kept repouring the water, creating a mini waterfall on the table.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like repouring warmth into a cold heart.
meanings.sent5: The sound of repouring rain outside made the cozy atmosphere even more inviting.

meanings.definition: The act of filling a container again with liquid.
meanings.sent1: The repouring of the pitcher was necessary to serve all the guests.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the repouring of the tea from the pot into her cup.
meanings.sent3: The repouring of the fountain made it seem like a magical never-ending drink source.
meanings.sent4: The repouring of love into their relationship made it stronger than ever.
meanings.sent5: The repouring of sunlight through the window brightened up the room.
